sample_tweets_generated.description: Sample tweets generated using the synthesis framework, drawing from knowledge JSONs

tweets.tweet:
August 19, 1978: Cinema Rex, Abadan. 420 burned alive. Blamed on Shah. Actually: Islamist militants.

January 8, 2026: Rasht Bazaar. Protesters burned alive. Blamed on 'rioters.' Actually: IRGC.

Same fire. Same lies. 47 years apart.

The mullahs built their regime on the ashes of Cinema Rex - a massacre THEY committed.

Now they're burning Iranians again in Rasht.

Arsonists don't change. Only their victims.

1978: Iranians wanted freedom.
1979: Khomeini stole it.
1981-88: He murdered everyone who helped him.
2026: The grandchildren of the real revolutionaries are finishing the job.

This isn't a new revolution. It's the SAME revolution, 47 years delayed.

Christopher Hitchens called 1979 'a counter-revolutionary mission to destroy the people's revolution.'

He was right.

For 47 years the counter-revolutionaries ruled. Now their time is up.

The 1979 coalition:
- Leftists (murdered 1981-88)
- Liberals (purged 1980-81)
- Nationalists (imprisoned)
- Islamists (the only survivors)

Khomeini didn't lead a revolution. He hijacked one and killed the revolutionaries.

1906: Iran's Constitutional Revolution - the FIRST in the Islamic world. Before Turkey. Before anyone.

1953: CIA destroyed it.
1979: Mullahs buried it.
2026: Iranians resurrecting it.

120 years is a long time to complete one revolution. But we're almost there.

'Iran has no democratic tradition.'

Wrong.

1906 Constitutional Revolution.
1951 elected PM Mossadegh.
120 years of parliamentary memory.

Iran has MORE democratic history than most of Europe had before WWII.

Iraq 2003:
- Created by Britain 1920
- No democratic history
- Iran next door sabotaging

Iran 2026:
- 2,500 years of statehood
- Constitutional revolution 1906
- No neighbor can sabotage

Not the same.

Afghanistan literacy: 30%
Iran literacy: 97%

Afghanistan women in university: <20%
Iran women in university: 60%

Afghanistan never had democracy.
Iran had constitutional government in 1906.

Stop comparing them.

Iran spent 20 years making Iraq a quagmire. Funded militias. Provided IEDs. Killed Americans.

Now Iran is having its own revolution.

But there's no Iran next door to sabotage it.

Karma is real.

'Remember Iraq!' they say.

OK. Let's remember:
- Iraq: Imposed democracy where none existed
- Iran: Support democracy where people are DYING for it

These are opposites.

The Iraq lesson is real. But it doesn't apply to Iran.

1980: Saddam invaded. Expected Khuzestan Arabs to defect.
They fought FOR Iran.

1946: Soviets created puppet 'Azerbaijan Republic.'
Azeris stayed Iranian.

2026: Kurds, Azeris, Baluch, Arabs - all chanting together.

2,500 years of unity doesn't break.

Yugoslavia was created in 1918 and fell apart in 1991.

Iran has been a nation for 2,500 years.

Persian culture, Persian language, Persian poetry - shared by Kurds, Azeris, Baluch alike.

We're not Yugoslavia. We never were.

1828: Treaty of Turkmenchay. Russia took the Caucasus.
2021: 25-year Iran-China deal. Iranians called it 'new Turkmenchay.'

The mullahs sold Iran to survive.

A free Iran will be partner to all, client to none.

For 2,000 years, Persia and China were equals - twin pillars of Asian civilization.

Now the mullahs prostrate themselves before Beijing for survival.

A free Iran restores the balance. The Silk Road was two-way trade, not Chinese colonization.

Russia 1908: Helped Shah bombard Iran's parliament.
Russia 1941: Tried to carve off Azerbaijan.
Russia 2026: Supports the mullahs.

Russia has ALWAYS opposed Iranian democracy.

They fear a free Iran on their border. They should.

Pahlavi doesn't need to choose East or West.

A free Iran has leverage BECAUSE everyone wants access:
- China needs transit routes
- Russia fears our potential
- West wants our market

89 million people. 2nd largest gas reserves. Play them all.

Guadeloupe, January 1979:
Carter, Giscard, Callaghan, Schmidt.
They agreed: Shah must go.

Khomeini's aide sent them a thank-you fax.

47 years of terror followed.

2026: Another crossroads. Choose wisely.

The Shah died in exile. Every 'ally' refused him asylum except Sadat.

Banks that held his money? Refused.
Countries that sold him weapons? Refused.
Carter admin? Pushed him out.

Only Sadat - who would himself be assassinated - stood by him.

Remember who helps when you fall.

1988: Khomeini executed 5,000-30,000 political prisoners.
2019: 'Bloody November' - 1,500 killed.
2022: Mahsa Amini protests - 500+ killed.
2026: 12,000+ massacred in 2 weeks.

Each uprising bigger. Each crackdown bloodier.

The regime is running out of time.

12,000+ Iranians killed since December 28.

That's more than:
- Tiananmen Square (est. 2,000-3,000)
- Bloody Sunday + all Troubles (~3,500 total)
- Kent State × 3,000

The world is watching the largest massacre since Tiananmen. In real time.

how_to_generate: 2. Pull relevant facts from knowledge JSONs
5. Keep under 280 characters or create thread
best_practices: Always ground in specific historical facts with dates
End with forward-looking statement or question
Avoid excessive hashtags - let content speak
Thread complex topics rather than oversimplify
